text: Hello :) I was wondering if there's a way to write out the value of different choices from a custom property with multiple choices?
Is there any hubl to convert back to text from MD5 Hash code?
No
MD5 is broken, but it's not _that_ broken
To clarify, you have a custom module with a choice field with the multi-select active correct?
Is there a way to get the group ID from a content variable? Like a content.group_id or something?...
What type of content?

In a coded template, I want to set the default padding of a section on desktop, but then have it “unset” back to any theme default that is set on mobile, without having to explicably set the mobile padding to a value in the template. Anyone know of a way to do this?
Oh, sorry, as in blog content.
I'm doing a related posts thing, and I'm trying to check which group a post belongs to..
So by 'group' are you talking about the tags that you attach to each blog post?
Are you trying to do this on every section or is it just a one-off for a single section?
question 2: is this just a dnd section you made on a page or is it a saved section for the theme?
Ah, no, as in the Blog group. Like this:
Just a `{% dnd_section %}` in a coded template, and a one-off.
Normally i can get the value by group.id, but that gives the id of the group which the current post belongs to..
Ah, so those are completely different blogs. So if you are doing a related post section you really just need to call the blog by id

I have default padding for dnd-sections set in the theme for mobile and desktop, but I want to set the default desktop padding for this one section a bit larger than the theme default on desktop, and revert back to the theme default for mobile.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions>
check out the 'blog_recent_posts' function here

well the thing is, sometimes the posts are selected manually. so if im going to not use that function, i will need to check the individual content, if that's possible. If not then.. hmm.. i guess there's not much i can do.
ohhh I see. You would need to call that function dynamically with the blog id based on the post that you are in.

okay so it is already a section template partial? If that is the case then you can add a class to the section like you normally could on a dnd area. Then you could add the padding manually in the css just for that breakpoint and revert it back on mobile.

I'm sorry, that's wrong. I guess I'm still confused about what you are trying to do. When I see a related posts section I would think it was in the same group as the current post. Which would mean the group.id would work. Sorry I am misunderstanding.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas/sections>
